title: Concepts of Stable Diffusion Introduced
content:
**Laid the theoretical groundwork for diffusion models, inspiring future advancements in generative modeling.**
The introduction of diffusion models as a framework for generative tasks, leveraging the idea of gradually adding and removing noise from data.

Sohl-Dickstein J., Weiss E.A., Maheswaranathan N., Ganguli S. (2015). Deep Unsupervised Learning using Nonequilibrium Thermodynamics.
[:octicons-book-24:](https://arxiv.org/abs/1503.03585){target='_blank'}

title: Denoising Diffusion Probabilistic Models (DDPM)
content:
**Established a practical and effective approach to training diffusion models for high-quality image generation.**
The DDPM framework introduced a method for training diffusion models by learning to reverse a gradual noising process, enabling the generation of high-fidelity images.

Ho J., Jain A., Abbeel P. (2020). Denoising Diffusion Probabilistic Models.
[:octicons-book-24:](https://arxiv.org/abs/2006.11239){target='_blank'}

title: Denoising Diffusion Implicit Models (DDIM)
content:
**Improved sampling efficiency and flexibility in diffusion models, paving the way for faster image generation.**
The DDIM approach introduced a non-Markovian diffusion process that allows for faster sampling while maintaining high-quality outputs.

Song J., Meng C., Ermon S. (2020). Denoising Diffusion Implicit Models.
[:octicons-book-24:](https://arxiv.org/abs/2010.02502){target='_blank'}
